references: D. M. Bressoud, Proofs and Confirmations, Camb. Univ. Press, 1999; cf. p. 89.
links: Lars Blomberg, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: Write n in binary; add positions where there are 1's followed by 0's, counting from right.
example: 83 = 1010011 has 1's followed by 0's in positions 2 and 5 (reading from the right), so a(83)=7.
maple: A049502 := proc(n)    local a,ndgs,p ;    a := 0 ;    ndgs := convert(n,base,2) ;    for p from 1 to nops(ndgs)-1 do        if op(p,ndgs)- op(p+1,ndgs) = 1 then            a := a+p ;        end if;    end do:    a ;end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 17 2012
prog: (Haskell)a049502 = f 0 1 where   f m i x = if x <= 4                then m else f (if mod x 4 == 1                                  then m + i else m) (i + 1) $ div x 2-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 17 2015
